org.jpac

Class Fireable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpac.Fireable
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProcessEvent

    public abstract class Fireable
extends java.lang.Object
    base class of all event, which might occur during the life time of an elbfisch application

    • Method Detail

      • initStates

        protected void initStates()

      • fire

        public abstract boolean fire()
                      throws ProcessException
        is called by jPac in every cycle to check, if the fire condition occured the fire condition must be true for at least one call. on occurrence it is latched by the Fireable, until it is processed. Must not be called by the application directly.
        Returns:
        true, if the fire condition occured
        Throws:
        ProcessException - if the application code produces an process exception. It is passed onto the awaiting module.

      • evaluateFiredCondition

        public boolean evaluateFiredCondition()
                               throws ProcessException
        checks, if the event has been fired
        Returns:
        true: event is fired
        Throws:
        ProcessException

      • isFired

        public boolean isFired()
        used to check, if a fireable has been fired. Keeps its state, until reset() is called.
        Returns:
        true: the Fireable has been fired
        Throws:
        ProcessException

      • reset

        public void reset()
        used to reset the Fireable to its initial state.

      • monitor

        public void monitor()
             throws InconsistencyException
        used to set a monitor on a Fireable. If it is fired, a MonitorException is thrown to the monitoring module if the Firable is already monitored, this call will be ignored. BUT: There might be situations, where jPac is unable to detect, that this Fireable or a certain complex fire condition is already monitored. To avoid this reliably, aspecially inside of loops, instantiate the fireable once outside the loop and call monitor() upon this instance.
        Throws:
        InconsistencyException - thrown, if an jpac internal problem arose

      • unmonitor

        public void unmonitor()
        used to reset a monitor on a Fireable.

      • equalsCondition

        protected boolean equalsCondition(Fireable f)
        used, to check, if this fireable implements the identical fire condition as f. CAUTION: if not overwritten, equalsCondition() returns false by default
        Parameters:
        f - the Fireable to check
        Returns:
        true, if both fire conditions match
